fr.emse.simulator.astar

Class AStarPathFinder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.emse.simulator.astar.AStarPathFinder

  • public class AStarPathFinder
extends java.lang.Object
    This class compute a classical pathfinding algorithm (a-star) in a given SimulationMap and using a given Heuristic, using a grid of nodes to memorize the paths.
    Author:
    Gauthier Picard (EMSE) : picard@emse.fr

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Node> closed
      the list of already examined nodes
      private Heuristic heuristic
      the heuristic used by the a-star algorithm
      private LocalCost localCost
      the local cost used to calculate 1 hop movement
      private Node[][] nodes
      a grid of Nodes for memorizing costs and paths
      private java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<? extends Occupant>> occupantClassesNotObstacle
      the classes of object that are not considered as obstacles
      private SortedList<Node> open
      the sorted list of nodes to examine
      private SimulationMap simulationMap
      the simulationMap in which the paths are computed

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AStarPathFinder(SimulationMap simulationMap, Heuristic heuristic, LocalCost localCost, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<? extends Occupant>> occupantClassesNotObstacle)
      This method creates a path finder using the classical pathfinding algorithm (a-star) in a given SimulationMap and using a given Heuristic.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNeighbours(Node node, Node target)
      This method returns the set of neighbours nodes of a node, i.e. nodes that can be reached by one movement (adjacent empty cells), including the target if reachable.
      java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getShortestPath(Cell startCell, Cell targetCell)
      This method computes the shortest path between two cells, using the a-star algorithm.

    • Constructor Detail

      • AStarPathFinder

        public AStarPathFinder(SimulationMap simulationMap,
               Heuristic heuristic,
               LocalCost localCost,
               java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Class<? extends Occupant>> occupantClassesNotObstacle)
        This method creates a path finder using the classical pathfinding algorithm (a-star) in a given SimulationMap and using a given Heuristic.
        Parameters:
        simulationMap - the simulationMap in which the paths are computed
        heuristic - the heuristic used by the a-star algorithm
        localCost - the cost for going through cells
        occupantClassesNotObstacle - a set of classes that are not considered as obstacles

    • Method Detail

      • getShortestPath

        public java.util.ArrayList<Cell> getShortestPath(Cell startCell,
                                        Cell targetCell)
        This method computes the shortest path between two cells, using the a-star algorithm.
        Parameters:
        startCell - the cell to start the search from
        targetCell - the cell to reach
        Returns:
        the set of cells between the startCell and the targetCell composing the shortest path, if any, else null.

      • getNeighbours

        private java.util.ArrayList<Node> getNeighbours(Node node,
                                      Node target)
        This method returns the set of neighbours nodes of a node, i.e. nodes that can be reached by one movement (adjacent empty cells), including the target if reachable.
        Parameters:
        node - the central node
        target - the node to reach
        Returns:
        the set of nodes that can be reached by one movement (adjacent cells)
